title: [FEA] Add evolved schema for type checking and filtering in Avro file reader

labels.name: task
labels.description: Work required that improves the product but is not user facing

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

The avro file reader now uses readDataSchema directly as the schema for reading the file, instead of checking whether each column exists in the file and uses a supported type. It may cause some problems when the user specifies an invalid read schema.

**Describe the solution you'd like**

We can add an evolved schema from readschema and dataSchema to do type checking and filtering, just like orc reader and parquet reader do.

The schema evolution should:
- Add a column that is in the read schema but not in the file schema.
- Remove a column that is not in the read schema, but is in the file schema.
- Throw exceptions for types that are not supported by the GPU
- Try to do a type conversion when the types are inconsistent

**Additional context**

[Schema evolution in Orc](https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/blob/branch-22.08/sql-plugin/src/main/scala/com/nvidia/spark/rapids/GpuOrcScan.scala#L586)

[checkTypeCompatibility in Orc](https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/blob/branch-22.08/sql-plugin/src/main/scala/com/nvidia/spark/rapids/GpuOrcScan.scala#L1182)
